member.name: T:System.Index
member.summary: Represent a type can be used to index a collection either from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct an Index using a value and indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.param: The index value. it has to be zero or positive number.
Indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.remarks: If the Index constructed from the end, index value 1 means pointing at the last element and index value 0 means pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: P:System.Index.Start
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at first element.

member.name: P:System.Index.End
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromStart(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the start at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the start.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the end at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the end.

member.name: P:System.Index.Value
member.summary: Returns the index value.

member.name: P:System.Index.IsFromEnd
member.summary: Indicates whether the index is from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.GetOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the offset from the start using the giving collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the Index will be used with. length has to be a positive value
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter and the returned offset value against negative values. we don't validate either the returned offset is greater than the input length. It is expected Index will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. If the returned offset is negative and then used to index a collection will get out of range exception which will be same affect as the validation.

member.name: M:System.Index.Equals(System.Index)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another Index object.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.summary: Converts integer number to an Index.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsExternalInit
member.summary: Reserved to be used by the compiler for tracking metadata. This class should not be used by developers in source code.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.SkipLocalsInitAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate to the compiler that the .locals init flag should not be set in method headers.
member.remarks: This attribute is unsafe because it may reveal uninitialized memory to the application in certain instances (e.g., reading from uninitialized stackalloc'd memory). If applied to a method directly, the attribute applies to that method and all nested functions (lambdas, local functions) below it. If applied to a type or module, it applies to all methods nested inside. This attribute is intentionally not permitted on assemblies. Use at the module level instead to apply to multiple type declarations.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TupleElementNamesAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the use of on a member is meant to be treated as a tuple with element names.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TupleElementNamesAttribute.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Specifies, in a pre-order depth-first traversal of a type's construction, which occurrences are meant to carry element names.
member.remarks: This constructor is meant to be used on types that contain an instantiation of that contains element names. For instance, if C is a generic type with two type parameters, then a use of the constructed type C{, might be intended to treat the first type argument as a tuple with element names and the second as a tuple without element names. In which case, the appropriate attribute specification should use a transformNames value of { "name1", "name2", null, null, null }.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TupleElementNamesAttribute.TransformNames
member.summary: Specifies, in a pre-order depth-first traversal of a type's construction, which elements are meant to carry element names.

member.name: T:System.IStructTupleInternal
member.summary: Helper so we can call some tuple methods recursively without knowing the underlying types.

member.name: T:System.ValueTuple
member.summary: The ValueTuple types (from arity 0 to 8) comprise the runtime implementation that underlies tuples in C# and struct tuples in F#. Aside from created via language syntax, they are most easily created via the ValueTuple.Create factory methods. The System.ValueTuple types differ from the System.Tuple types in that: - they are structs rather than classes, - they are mutable rather than readonly, and - their members (such as Item1, Item2, etc) are fields rather than properties.

member.name: M:System.ValueTuple`2.System#Collections#IStructuralEquatable#Equals(System.Object,System.Collections.IEqualityComparer)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the current instance is equal to a specified object based on a specified comparison method.
member.param: The object to compare with this instance.
An object that defines the method to use to evaluate whether the two objects are equal.
member.returns: if the current instance is equal to the specified object; otherwise, .
member.remarks:
This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the instance is cast to an interface.
The implementation is called only if other is not , and if it can be successfully cast (in C#) or converted (in Visual Basic) to a whose components are of the same types as those of the current instance. The IStructuralEquatable.Equals(Object, IEqualityComparer) method first passes the values of the objects to be compared to the implementation. If this method call returns , the method is called again and passed the values of the two instances.

member.name: M:System.ValueTuple`5.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the current instance is equal to a specified object.
member.param: The object to compare with this instance.
member.returns: if the current instance is equal to the specified object; otherwise, .
member.remarks:
The parameter is considered to be equal to the current instance under the following conditions:
It is a value type.
Its components are of the same types as those of the current instance.
Its components are equal to those of the current instance. Equality is determined by the default object equality comparer for each component.

member.name: M:System.ValueTuple`5.Equals(System.ValueTuple{`0,`1,`2,`3,`4})
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the current instance is equal to a specified .

member.returns: if the current instance is equal to the specified tuple; otherwise, .
member.remarks: The parameter is considered to be equal to the current instance if each of its fields are equal to that of the current instance, using the default comparer for that field's type.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method builds string by format pattern and (optional) arguments. Parameter, which contains format string, should be given in constructor. The format string should be in -like form.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.param: Specifies which parameter of an annotated method should be treated as format-string

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.UsedImplicitlyAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked symbol is used implicitly (e.g. via reflection, in external library), so this symbol will not be marked as unused (as well as by other usage inspections).

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.MeansImplicitUseAttribute
member.summary: Should be used on attributes and causes ReSharper to not mark symbols marked with such attributes as unused (as well as by other usage inspections)

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Access
member.summary: Only entity marked with attribute considered used.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Assign
member.summary: Indicates implicit assignment to a member.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedWithFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type with fixed constructor signature. That means any unused constructor parameters won't be reported as such.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedNoFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags
member.summary: Specify what is considered used implicitly when marked with or .

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.Members
member.summary: Members of entity marked with attribute are considered used.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.WithMembers
member.summary: Entity marked with attribute and all its members considered used.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.PublicAPIAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is intended to mark publicly available API which should not be removed and so is treated as used.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.InstantHandleAttribute
member.summary: Tells code analysis engine if the parameter is completely handled when the invoked method is on stack. If the parameter is a delegate, indicates that delegate is executed while the method is executed. If the parameter is an enumerable, indicates that it is enumerated while the method is executed.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.PureAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a method does not make any observable state changes. The same as System.Diagnostics.Contracts.PureAttribute.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.LinqTunnelAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that method is pure LINQ method, with postponed enumeration (like Enumerable.Select, .Where). This annotation allows inference of [InstantHandle] annotation for parameters of delegate type by analyzing LINQ method chains.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.NoEnumerationAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that IEnumerable, passed as parameter, is not enumerated.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Async.AsyncDbConnection
member.summary: Implements wrapper over instance with synchronous implementation of asynchronous methods. Providers with async operations support could override its methods with asynchronous implementations.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Async.AsyncDbTransaction
member.summary: Basic implementation with fallback to synchronous operations if corresponding functionality missing from .

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Async.AsyncEnumerableExtensions
member.summary: Contains custom extension methods for interface.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.Async.AsyncEnumerableExtensions.ToListAsync``1(LinqToDB.Async.IAsyncEnumerable{``0},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously creates a from by enumerating it asynchronously.
member.remarks: Multiple active operations on the same context instance are not supported. Use 'await' to ensure that any asynchronous operations have completed before calling another method on this context.
member.param: A to observe while waiting for the task to complete.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains a that contains elements from the input sequence.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.Async.AsyncEnumerableExtensions.ToArrayAsync``1(LinqToDB.Async.IAsyncEnumerable{``0},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously creates an array from .
member.remarks: Multiple active operations on the same context instance are not supported. Use 'await' to ensure that any asynchronous operations have completed before calling another method on this context.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration
member.summary: Contains global linq2db settings.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.IsStructIsScalarType
F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.UseEnumValueNameForStringColumns
member.summary: If true - Enum values are stored as by calling ToString(). Default value: true.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.ContinueOnCapturedContext
member.summary: Defines value to pass to method for all linq2db internal await operations. Default value: false.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.OptimizeForSequentialAccess
member.summary: Enables mapping expression to be compatible with behavior. Note that it doesn't switch linq2db to use behavior for queries, so this optimization could be used for too. Default value: false.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.MaxBinaryParameterLengthLogging
member.summary: Determines the length after which logging of binary data in SQL will be truncated. This is to avoid Out-Of-Memory exceptions when getting SqlText from or for logging or other purposes.
member.remarks: This value defaults to 100. Use a value of -1 to disable and always log full binary. Set to 0 to truncate all binary data.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.MaxStringParameterLengthLogging
member.summary: Determines the length after which logging of string data in SQL will be truncated. This is to avoid Out-Of-Memory exceptions when getting SqlText from or for logging or other purposes.
member.remarks: This value defaults to 200. Use a value of -1 to disable and always log full string. Set to 0 to truncate all string data.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Data.ThrowOnDisposed
member.summary: Enables throwing of when access disposed instance. Default value: true.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Data.BulkCopyUseConnectionCommandTimeout
member.summary: Controls behavior of bulk copy timeout if is not provided. - if true - the current timeout on the is used - if false - command timeout is infinite. Default value: false.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq
member.summary: LINQ query settings.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.PreloadGroups
member.summary: Controls how group data for LINQ queries ended with GroupBy will be loaded: - if true - group data will be loaded together with main query, resulting in 1 + N queries, where N - number of groups; - if false - group data will be loaded when you call enumerator for specific group . Default value: false.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.IgnoreEmptyUpdate
member.summary: Controls behavior of linq2db when there is no updateable fields in Update query: - if true - query not executed and Update operation returns 0 as number of affected records; - if false - will be thrown. Default value: false.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.GenerateExpressionTest
member.summary: Enables generation of test class for each LINQ query, executed while this option is enabled. This option could be useful for issue reporting, when you need to provide reproducible case. Test file will be placed to linq2db subfolder of temp folder and exact file path will be logged to data connection tracing infrastructure. See for more details. Default value: false.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.TraceMapperExpression
member.summary: Enables logging of generated mapping expression to data connection tracing infrastructure. See for more details. Default value: false.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.DoNotClearOrderBys
member.summary: Controls behavior, when LINQ query chain contains multiple or calls: - if true - non-first OrderBy* call will be treated as ThenBy* call; - if false - OrderBy* call will discard sort specifications, added by previous OrderBy* and ThenBy* calls. Default value: false.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.OptimizeJoins
F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.CompareNullsAsValues
member.summary: If set to true nullable fields would be checked for IS NULL in Equal/NotEqual comparisons. This affects: Equal, NotEqual, Not Contains Default value: true.
member.example:
public class MyEntity { public int? Value; }
db.MyEntity.Where(e => e.Value != 10)
from e1 in db.MyEntity join e2 in db.MyEntity on e1.Value equals e2.Value select e1
var filter = new [] {1, 2, 3}; db.MyEntity.Where(e => ! filter.Contains(e.Value))
Would be converted to next queries:
SELECT Value FROM MyEntity WHERE Value IS NULL OR Value != 10
SELECT e1.Value FROM MyEntity e1 INNER JOIN MyEntity e2 ON e1.Value = e2.Value OR (e1.Value IS NULL AND e2.Value IS NULL)
SELECT Value FROM MyEntity WHERE Value IS NULL OR NOT Value IN (1, 2, 3)

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.GuardGrouping
member.summary: Controls behavior of LINQ query, which ends with GroupBy call. - if true - will be thrown for such queries; - if false - behavior is controlled by option. Default value: true.
member.remarks: More details.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.DisableQueryCache
member.summary:
Used to disable LINQ expressions caching for queries. This cache reduces time, required for query parsing but have several side-effects:
- cached LINQ expressions could contain references to external objects as parameters, which could lead to memory leaks if those objects are not used anymore by other code
- cache access synchronization could lead to bigger latencies than it saves.
Default value: false.
It is not recommended to enable this option as it could lead to severe slowdown. Better approach will be to call method to cleanup cache after queries, that produce severe memory leaks you need to fix.
More details.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.CacheSlidingExpiration
member.summary: Specifies timeout when query will be evicted from cache since last execution of query. Default value is 1 hour.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.PreferApply
member.summary: Used to generate CROSS APPLY or OUTER APPLY if possible. Default value: true.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.KeepDistinctOrdered
member.summary: Allows SQL generation to automatically transform SELECT DISTINCT value FROM Table ORDER BY date Into GROUP BY equivalent if syntax is not supported Default value: true.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.ParameterizeTakeSkip
member.summary: Enables Take/Skip parameterization. Default value: true.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.EnableAutoFluentMapping
member.summary: If true, auto support for fluent mapping is ON, which means that you do not need to create additional MappingSchema object to define FluentMapping. You can use context.MappingSchema.GetFluentMappingBuilder().

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.SqlServer

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.SqlServer.UseSchemaOnlyToGetSchema
member.summary: if set to true, SchemaProvider uses to get metadata. Otherwise the sp_describe_first_result_set sproc is used. Default value: false.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.LinqService

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.LinqService.SerializeAssemblyQualifiedName
member.summary: Controls format of type name, sent over remote context: - if true - name from used; - if false - name from used. Default value: false.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.LinqService.ThrowUnresolvedTypeException
member.summary: Controls behavior of linq2db, when it cannot load by type name on query deserialization: - if true - will be thrown; - if false - type load error will be ignored. Default value: false.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.RetryPolicy
member.summary: Retry policy global settings.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.RetryPolicy.Factory
member.summary: Retry policy factory method, used to create retry policy for new instance. If factory method is not set, retry policy is not used. Not set by default.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.RetryPolicy.UseDefaultPolicy
member.summary: Status of use of default retry policy. Getter returns true if default retry policy used, and false if custom retry policy used or retry policy is not set. Setter sets to default retry policy factory if is true, otherwise removes retry policy.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.RetryPolicy.DefaultMaxRetryCount
member.summary: The default number of retry attempts. Default value: 5.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.RetryPolicy.DefaultMaxDelay
member.summary: The default maximum time delay between retries, must be nonnegative. Default value: 30 seconds.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.RetryPolicy.DefaultRandomFactor
member.summary: The default maximum random factor, must not be lesser than 1. Default value: 1.1.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.RetryPolicy.DefaultExponentialBase
member.summary: The default base for the exponential function used to compute the delay between retries, must be positive. Default value: 2.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.RetryPolicy.DefaultCoefficient
member.summary: The default coefficient for the exponential function used to compute the delay between retries, must be nonnegative. Default value: 1 second.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Sql
member.summary: SQL generation global settings.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Sql.AssociationAlias
member.summary:
Format for association alias.
Default value: "a_{0}".
In the following query
var query = from child in db.Child select new { child.ChildID, child.Parent.Value1 };
for association Parent will be generated association A_Parent in resulting SQL.
SELECT [child].[ChildID], [a_Parent].[Value1] FROM [Child] [child] LEFT JOIN [Parent] [a_Parent] ON ([child].[ParentID] = [a_Parent].[ParentID])
Set this value to null to disable special alias generation queries.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Sql.GenerateFinalAliases
member.summary:
Indicates whether SQL Builder should generate aliases for final projection. It is not required for correct query processing but simplifies SQL analysis.
Default value: false.
For the query
var query = from child in db.Child select new { TrackId = child.ChildID, };
When property is true
SELECT [child].[ChildID] as [TrackId] FROM [Child] [child]
Otherwise alias will be removed
SELECT [child].[ChildID] FROM [Child] [child]

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Configuration.IDataProviderSettings.Attributes
member.summary:
Extra provider-specific parameters.
Sybase:
assemblyName - Sybase provider assembly name.
SAP HANA:
assemblyName - SAP HANA provider assembly name.
Oracle:
assemblyName - Oracle provider assembly name.
SQL Server:
assemblyName - provider assembly name. Recognized values: "System.Data", "System.Data.SqlClient", "Microsoft.Data.SqlClient".
version - T-SQL support level, recognized values: "2005", "2008", "2012", "2014", "2016", "2017", "2018". Default: "2008".
DB2:
version - DB2 platform, recognized values: "zOS" or "z/OS" - DB2 for z/OS. Default platform - DB2 LUW.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.Configuration.LinqToDBConnectionOptionsBuilderExtensions.UseSqlServer(LinqToDB.Configuration.LinqToDBConnectionOptionsBuilder,System.String)
member.summary: Configure connection to use SQL Server default provider, dialect and connection string.
member.returns: The builder instance so calls can be chained.
member.remarks:
Default provider configured using option and set to by default.
SQL Server dialect will be choosen automatically:
if (default: true) enabled, Linq To DB will query server for version
otherwise will be used as default dialect.
For more fine-grained configuration see overload.

member.summary: Counts number of locks, put on underlying connection. Connection will not be released while counter is not zero.

member.summary: Gets or sets command execution timeout in seconds. Negative timeout value means that default timeout will be used. 0 timeout value corresponds to infinite timeout. By default timeout is not set and default value for current provider used.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataContextTransaction.BeginTransaction(System.Data.IsolationLevel)
member.summary: Start new transaction with specified isolation level. If underlying connection already has transaction, it will be rolled back.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataContextTransaction.BeginTransactionAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Start new transaction asynchronously with default isolation level. If underlying connection already has transaction, it will be rolled back.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataContextTransaction.BeginTransactionAsync(System.Data.IsolationLevel,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Start new transaction asynchronously with specified isolation level. If underlying connection already has transaction, it will be rolled back.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataContextTransaction.CommitTransaction
member.summary: Commits started transaction.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataContextTransaction.RollbackTransaction
member.summary: Rollbacks started transaction.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataContextTransaction.CommitTransactionAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Commits started transaction. If underlying provider doesn't support asynchronous commit, it will be performed synchronously.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataContextTransaction.RollbackTransactionAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Rollbacks started transaction asynchronously. If underlying provider doesn't support asynchronous rollback, it will be performed synchronously.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataContextTransaction.Dispose
member.summary: Rollbacks started transaction (if any).

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataExtensions.CreateTable``1(LinqToDB.IDataContext,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,LinqToDB.SqlQuery.DefaultNullable,System.String,LinqToDB.TableOptions)
member.summary: Creates new table in database for mapping class . Information about table name, columns names and types is taken from mapping class.
member.param: Optional table name to override default table name, extracted from mapping.
Optional database name, to override default database name. See method for support information per provider.
Optional schema/owner name, to override default name. See method for support information per provider.
Optional replacement for "CREATE TABLE table_name" header. Header is a template with {0} parameter for table name.
Optional SQL, appended to generated create table statement.

Defines how columns nullability flag should be generated:
- - generate only NOT NULL for non-nullable fields. Missing nullability information treated as NULL by database.
- - generate only NULL for nullable fields. Missing nullability information treated as NOT NULL by database.
- - explicitly generate NULL and NOT NULL for all columns. Default value: .
Optional linked server name. See method for support information per provider.
Table options. See enum for support information per provider.

Optional replacement for "CREATE TABLE table_name" header. Header is a template with {0} parameter for table name.
Optional SQL, appended to generated create table statement.

Defines how columns nullability flag should be generated:
- - generate only NOT NULL for non-nullable fields. Missing nullability information treated as NULL by database.
- - generate only NULL for nullable fields. Missing nullability information treated as NOT NULL by database.
- - explicitly generate NULL and NOT NULL for all columns. Default value: .
Optional linked server name. See method for support information per provider.
Table options. See enum for support information per provider.

If false, any exception during drop operation will be silently caught and 0 returned. This behavior is not correct and will be fixed in future to mask only missing table exceptions. Tracked by issue. Default value: true.

Optional database name, to override default database name. See method for support information per provider.
Optional schema/owner name, to override default name. See method for support information per provider.

If false, any exception during drop operation will be silently caught and 0 returned. This behavior is not correct and will be fixed in future to mask only missing table exceptions. Tracked by issue. Default value: true.
Optional linked server name. See method for support information per provider.
Table options. See enum for support information per provider.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataExtensions.FromSql``1(LinqToDB.IDataContext,LinqToDB.Common.RawSqlString,System.Object[])

summary.para: Creates a LINQ query based on a raw SQL query.

If the database provider supports composing on the supplied SQL, you can compose on top of the raw SQL query using LINQ operators - context.FromSql<Blogs>("SELECT * FROM dbo.Blogs").OrderBy(b => b.Name);

As with any API that accepts SQL it is important to parameterize any user input to protect against a SQL injection attack. You can include parameter place holders in the SQL query string and then supply parameter values as additional arguments. Any parameter values you supply will automatically be converted to a DbParameter - context.FromSql<Blogs>("SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SearchBlogs]({0})", userSuppliedSearchTerm);

This overload also accepts DbParameter instances as parameter values. context.FromSql<Blogs>("SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SearchBlogs]({0})", new DataParameter("@searchTerm", userSuppliedSearchTerm, DataType.Int64));

member.param: The values to be assigned to parameters.
member.remarks: Additional parentheses will be added to the query if first word in raw query is 'SELECT', otherwise users are responsible to add them themselves.
member.returns: An representing the raw SQL query.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataExtensions.SelectQuery``1(LinqToDB.IDataContext,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0}})

summary.para:
Creates a LINQ query based on expression. Returned represents single record.
Could be useful for function calls, querying of database variables, properties or sub-queries.

member.remarks:
Method works for most supported database engines, except databases which do not support SELECT Value without FROM statement.
For Oracle it will be translated to SELECT Value FROM SYS.DUAL

member.name: P:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Firebird.FirebirdConfiguration.IdentifierQuoteMode
member.summary: Specifies how identifiers like table and field names should be quoted.
member.remarks: Default value: .

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Firebird.FirebirdConfiguration.IsLiteralEncodingSupported
member.summary: Specifies that Firebird supports literal encoding. Availiable from version 2.5.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Firebird.FirebirdIdentifierQuoteMode
member.summary: Possible modes for Firebird identifier quotes. This enumeration covers only identifier quotation logic and don't handle identifier length limits.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Firebird.FirebirdIdentifierQuoteMode.None
member.summary: Do not quote identifiers. LINQ To DB will not check identifiers for validity (spaces, reserved words) is this mode. This mode should be used only for SQL Dialect < 3 and it is developer's responsibility to ensure that there is no identifiers in use that require quotation.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Firebird.FirebirdIdentifierQuoteMode.Quote
member.summary: Always quote identifiers. LINQ To DB will quote all identifiers, even if it is not required. Select this mode, if you need to preserve identifiers casing. Quoted identifiers not supported by SQL Dialect < 3.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Firebird.FirebirdIdentifierQuoteMode.Auto
member.summary: Quote identifiers if needed. LINQ To DB will quote identifiers, if they are not valid without quotation. This includes: - use of reserved words; - use of any characters except latin letters, digits, _ and $; - use digit, _ or $ as first character. This is default mode. Note that if you need to preserve casing of identifiers, you should use mode. Quoted identifiers not supported by SQL Dialect < 3.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlBulkCopy.MaxParameters
member.summary: Settings based on https://www.jooq.org/doc/3.12/manual/sql-building/dsl-context/custom-settings/settings-inline-threshold/ MySQL supports more but realistically this might be too much already for practical cases.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlBulkCopy.MaxSqlLength
member.summary: MySQL can support much larger sizes, based on https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/server-system-variables.html#sysvar_max_allowed_packet But we keep a smaller number here to avoid choking the network.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.MatchModifier
member.summary: Search modifier for MATCH AGAINST full-text search predicate.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.MatchModifier.NaturalLanguage
member.summary: Applies 'IN NATURAL LANGUAGE MODE' (default value) search modifier.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.MatchModifier.Boolean
member.summary: Applies 'IN BOOLEAN MODE' (default value) search modifier.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.MatchModifier.WithQueryExpansion
member.summary: Applies 'IN NATURAL LANGUAGE MODE WITH QUERY EXPANSION'/'WITH QUERY EXPANSION' search modifier.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.Match(LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.IMySqlExtensions,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Applies full-text search condition using MATCH AGAINST predicate against specified full-text columns using default mode (IN NATURAL LANGUAGE MODE). Example: MATCH(col1, col2) AGAINST('search query').
member.param: Full-text columns that should be queried.
member.returns: Returns true if full-text search found matching records.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.MatchRelevance(LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.IMySqlExtensions,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Calculates relevance of full-text search for current record using MATCH AGAINST predicate against specified full-text columns using default mode (IN NATURAL LANGUAGE MODE). Example: MATCH(col1, col2) AGAINST('search query').
member.param: Full-text columns that should be queried.
member.returns: Returns full-text search relevance value for current record.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.Match(LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.IMySqlExtensions,LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.MatchModifier,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Applies full-text search condition using MATCH AGAINST predicate against specified full-text columns using specified search modifier. Example: MATCH(col1, col2) AGAINST('search query' MODIFIER).
member.param: Full-text columns that should be queried.
member.returns: Returns true if full-text search found matching records.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.MatchRelevance(LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.IMySqlExtensions,LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.MatchModifier,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Calculates relevance of full-text search for current record using MATCH AGAINST predicate against specified full-text columns using specified search modifier. Example: MATCH(col1, col2) AGAINST('search query' MODIFIER).
member.param: Full-text columns that should be queried.
member.returns: Returns full-text search relevance value for current record.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Oracle.AlternativeBulkCopy
member.summary: Defines type of multi-row INSERT operation to generate for bulk copy mode.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Oracle.AlternativeBulkCopy.InsertAll
member.summary:
This mode generates INSERT ALL statement. Note that INSERT ALL doesn't support sequences and will use single generated value for all rows.
INSERT ALL INTO target_table VALUES(/*row data*/) ... INTO target_table VALUES(/*row data*/)

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Oracle.AlternativeBulkCopy.InsertInto
member.summary:
This mode performs regular INSERT INTO query with array of values for each column.
INSERT INTO target_table(/*columns*/) VALUES(:column1ArrayParameter, ..., :columnXArrayParameter)

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Oracle.AlternativeBulkCopy.InsertDual
member.summary:
This mode generates INSERT ... SELECT statement.
INSERT INTO target_table(/*columns*/) SELECT /*row data*/ FROM DUAL UNION ALL ... UNION ALL SELECT /*row data*/ FROM DUAL

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Oracle.Oracle11SqlOptimizer.ReplaceTakeSkipWithRowNum(LinqToDB.SqlQuery.SqlStatement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Replaces Take/Skip by ROWNUM usage. See 'Pagination with ROWNUM' for more information.
member.param: Statement which may contain take/skip modifiers.
Indicates when transformation needed only for subqueries.
member.returns: The same or modified statement when optimization has been performed.

member.remarks: Settings based on https://www.jooq.org/doc/3.12/manual/sql-building/dsl-context/custom-settings/settings-inline-threshold/ We subtract 1 based on possibility of provider using parameter for command.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Oracle.OracleBulkCopy._maxSqlLength
member.summary: Setting is conservative, based on https://docs.oracle.com/cd/A58617_01/server.804/a58242/ch5.htm Max is actually more arbitrary in later versions than Oracle 8.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.PostgreSQL.PostgreSQLDataProvider._npgsqlTypeMap
member.summary: Map of canonical PostgreSQL type name to NpgsqlDbType enumeration value. This map shouldn't be used directly, you should resolve PostgreSQL types using method, which takes into account different type aliases.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.PostgreSQL.PostgreSQLDataProvider.GetNativeType(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns enumeration value for requested postgresql type or null if type cannot be resolved. This method expects correct PostgreSQL type as input. Custom types not supported. Also could fail on some types as PostgreSQL have a lot of ways to write same type.
member.remarks: Returned value could be invalid for type, if range/array flags were applied. Don't try to use results of this function for anything except passing it directly to npgsql.

member.summary:

convert value to UTC value with zero
Use for timestamptz values
Use for timestamp values with kind
Default value: true.

member.remarks: Based on https://www.sqlite.org/limits.html. Since SQLite is parsed locally by the lib, we aren't worried about network congestion and keep the max.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SQLite.SQLiteDataProvider.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates the specified SQLite provider based on the provider name.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SQLite.SQLiteExtensions.Match(LinqToDB.DataProvider.SQLite.ISQLiteExtensions,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Applies full-text search condition using MATCH predicate against whole FTS table or specific column. Examples: "table MATCH 'search query'"/"table.column MATCH 'search query'".
member.param: Table or column to perform full-text search against.
member.returns: Returns true if full-text search found matching records.
member.remarks: FTS Support: FTS3/4, FTS5.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SQLite.SQLiteExtensions.MatchTable``1(LinqToDB.DataProvider.SQLite.ISQLiteExtensions,LinqToDB.ITable{``0},System.String)
member.summary: Performs full-text search query against against speficied table and returns search results. Example: "table('search query')".
member.param: Table to perform full-text search against.
member.returns: Returns table, filtered using specified search condition, applied to whole table.
member.remarks: FTS Support: FTS5.

member.summary: Provides access to rowid hidden column. Example: "table.rowid".

summary.para: This function returns the value of the current timestamp data type for the current database. The current database will have a guaranteed unique timestamp value.
Returns the local language identifier (ID) of the language that is currently being used.
Returns the name of the language currently being used.
Returns the current lock time-out setting in milliseconds for the current session.
Returns the maximum number of simultaneous user connections allowed on an instance of SQL Server. The number returned is not necessarily the number currently configured.
Returns the precision level used by decimal and numeric data types as currently set in the server.
Returns the nesting level of the current stored procedure execution (initially 0) on the local server.
Returns information about the current SET options.
Returns the name of the remote SQL Server database server as it appears in the login record.
Returns the name of the local server that is running SQL Server.

Returns the name of the registry key under which SQL Server is running. @@SERVICENAME returns 'MSSQLSERVER' if the current instance is the default instance; this function returns the instance name if the current instance is a named instance.
Returns the session ID of the current user process.
Returns the current value of the TEXTSIZE option.
Returns system and build information for the current installation of SQL Server.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.DataLength``1(``0)
member.summary:
DATALENGTH (Transact-SQL)
This function returns the number of bytes used to represent any expression. DATALENGTH becomes really helpful when used with data types that can store variable-length data, such as:
ntext
nvarchar
text
varbinary
varchar
For a NULL value, DATALENGTH returns NULL.
Use the LEN to return the number of characters encoded into a given string expression, and DATALENGTH to return the size in bytes for a given string expression. These outputs may differ depending on the data type and type of encoding used in the column. For more information on storage differences between different encoding types, see Collation and Unicode Support.
member.typeparam: An expression of any data type.
member.param: An expression of any data type.
member.returns: bigint if expression has an nvarchar(max), varbinary(max), or varchar(max) data type; otherwise int.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.IdentityCurrent(System.String)

summary.para: Returns the last identity value generated for a specified table or view. The last identity value generated can be for any session and any scope.

member.param: Is the name of the table or view whose identity value is returned. table_or_view is varchar, with no default.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.IdentityIncrement(System.String)

summary.para: Returns the increment value specified when creating a table or view's identity column.

member.param: Is an expression specifying the table or view to check for a valid identity increment value. table_or_view can be a character string constant enclosed in quotation marks. It can also be a variable, a function, or a column name. table_or_view is char, nchar, varchar, or nvarchar.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.IdentitySeed(System.String)

summary.para: Returns the original seed value specified when creating an identity column in a table or a view. Changing the current value of an identity column by using DBCC CHECKIDENT doesn't change the value returned by this function.

member.param: Is an expression specifying the table or view to check for a valid identity increment value. table_or_view can be a character string constant enclosed in quotation marks. It can also be a variable, a function, or a column name. table_or_view is char, nchar, varchar, or nvarchar.

summary.para: This function returns the current value of SET DATEFIRST, for a specific session.

This function returns the current database system timestamp as a datetime value, without the database time zone offset. CURRENT_TIMESTAMP derives this value from the operating system of the computer on which the instance of SQL Server runs.

This function returns the name of the time zone observed by a server or an instance. For SQL Managed Instance, return value is based on the time zone of the instance itself assigned during instance creation, not the time zone of the underlying operating system.

This function returns the ID of the time zone observed by a server or an instance. For Azure SQL Managed Instance, return value is based on the time zone of the instance itself assigned during instance creation, not the time zone of the underlying operating system.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.DateAdd(LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.DateParts,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)

summary.para: This function adds a number (a signed integer) to a datepart of an input date, and returns a modified date/time value.

member.param: The part of date to which DATEADD adds an integer number. This table lists all valid datepart arguments.

An expression that can resolve to an int that DATEADD adds to a datepart of date. DATEADD accepts user-defined variable values for number. DATEADD will truncate a specified number value that has a decimal fraction. It will not round the number value in this situation.

summary.para: Returns the current database system timestamp as a datetime value without the database time zone offset.

Returns the current database system timestamp as a datetime value. The database time zone offset is not included. This value represents the current UTC time (Coordinated Universal Time). This value is derived from the operating system of the computer on which the instance of SQL Server is running.
Returns a datetime2(7) value that contains the date and time of the computer on which the instance of SQL Server is running.
Returns a datetimeoffset(7) value that contains the date and time of the computer on which the instance of SQL Server is running. The time zone offset is included.

Returns a datetime2 value that contains the date and time of the computer on which the instance of SQL Server is running. The date and time is returned as UTC time (Coordinated Universal Time). The fractional second precision specification has a range from 1 to 7 digits. The default precision is 7 digits.
Returns 1 if the expression is a valid datetime value; otherwise, 0. ISDATE returns 0 if the expression is a datetime2 value.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.Round``1(``0,System.Int32,System.Int32)

summary.para: Returns a numeric value, rounded to the specified length or precision.

member.param: An expression of the exact numeric or approximate numeric data type category, except for the bit data type.

Is the precision to which numeric_expression is to be rounded. length must be an expression of type tinyint, smallint, or int. When length is a positive number, numeric_expression is rounded to the number of decimal positions specified by length. When length is a negative number, numeric_expression is rounded on the left side of the decimal point, as specified by length.

Is the type of operation to perform. function must be tinyint, smallint, or int. When function is omitted or has a value of 0 (default), numeric_expression is rounded. When a value other than 0 is specified, numeric_expression is truncated
member.returns: Return values have the same type as numeric_expression.

Is the schema-scoped object type. object_type is either varchar or nvarchar. If object_type is varchar, it is implicitly converted to nvarchar. For a list of object types, see the type column in sys.objects (Transact-SQL).

member.param: Is an expression that represents the ID of the object in the current database. id is int and is assumed to be a schema-scoped object in the current database context.
Is an expression that represents the information to be returned for the object specified by id. property can be one of the following values.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.ObjectPropertyEx(System.Nullable{System.Int32},LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.ObjectPropertyExName)

summary.para: Returns information about schema-scoped objects in the current database. For a list of these objects, see sys.objects (Transact-SQL). OBJECTPROPERTYEX cannot be used for objects that are not schema-scoped, such as data definition language (DDL) triggers and event notifications.

member.param: Is an expression that represents the ID of the object in the current database. id is int and is assumed to be a schema-scoped object in the current database context.
Is an expression that contains the information to be returned for the object specified by id. The return type is sql_variant. The following table shows the base data type for each property value.

summary.para: Returns the database name specified by the user in the database connection string. This database is specified by using the sqlcmd-d option (USE database). It can also be specified with the Open Database Connectivity (ODBC) data source expression (initial catalog = databasename).
This database is different from the default user database.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.ParseName(System.String,System.Int32)

summary.para: Returns the database schema name for schema-scoped objects. For a list of schema-scoped objects, see sys.objects (Transact-SQL).

member.param: Is the parameter that holds the name of the object for which to retrieve the specified object part. This parameter is an optionally-qualified object name. If all parts of the object name are qualified, this name can have four parts: the server name, the database name, the schema name, and the object name. Each part of the 'object_name' string is type sysname which is equivalent to nvarchar(128) or 256 bytes. If any part of the string exceeds 256 bytes, PARSENAME will return NULL for that part as it is not a valid sysname.

Is the object part to return. object_piece is of type int, and can have these values:
1 = Object name
2 = Schema name
3 = Database name
4 = Server name

summary.para: Returns the schema ID associated with a schema name.

summary.para: Returns the schema name associated with a schema ID.

member.param: The ID of the schema. schema_id is an int. If schema_id is not defined, SCHEMA_NAME will return the name of the default schema of the caller.

summary.para: Returns the last identity value inserted into an identity column in the same scope. A scope is a module: a stored procedure, trigger, function, or batch. Therefore, if two statements are in the same stored procedure, function, or batch, they are in the same scope.

member.param: An integer from 0 through 255. CHAR returns a NULL value for integer expressions outside this input range or not representing a complete character. Many common character sets share ASCII as a sub-set and will return the same character for integer values in the range 0 through 127.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.Format(System.Object,System.String)

summary.para: Returns a value formatted with the specified format and optional culture. Use the FORMAT function for locale-aware formatting of date/time and number values as strings. For general data type conversions, use CAST or CONVERT.

member.param: Expression of a supported data type to format. For a list of valid types, see the table in the following Remarks section.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.Left(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32})

summary.para: Returns the left part of a character string with the specified number of characters.

member.param: Is an expression of character or binary data. character_expression can be a constant, variable, or column. character_expression can be of any data type, except text or ntext, that can be implicitly converted to varchar or nvarchar. Otherwise, use the CAST function to explicitly convert character_expression.

Is a positive integer that specifies how many characters of the character_expression will be returned. If integer_expression is negative, an error is returned. If integer_expression is type bigint and contains a large value, character_expression must be of a large data type such as varchar(max). The integer_expression parameter counts a UTF-16 surrogate character as one character.
member.returns: Returns varchar when character_expression is a non-Unicode character data type. Returns nvarchar when character_expression is a Unicode character data type.

member.returns: bigint if expression is of the varchar(max), nvarchar(max) or varbinary(max) data types; otherwise, int.

summary.para: Returns the number of characters of the specified string expression, excluding trailing spaces.

member.returns: bigint if expression is of the varchar(max), nvarchar(max) or varbinary(max) data types; otherwise, int.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.NChar(System.Nullable{System.Int32})

summary.para: Returns the Unicode character with the specified integer code, as defined by the Unicode standard.

member.param: When the collation of the database does not contain the Supplementary Character (SC) flag, this is a positive integer from 0 through 65535 (0 through 0xFFFF). If a value outside this range is specified, NULL is returned.
member.returns: nchar(1) when the default database collation does not support supplementary characters. nvarchar(2) when the default database collation supports supplementary characters.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.PatIndex(System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Returns the starting position of the first occurrence of a pattern in a specified expression, or zeros if the pattern is not found, on all valid text and character data types.

member.param: Is a character expression that contains the sequence to be found. Wildcard characters can be used; however, the % character must come before and follow pattern (except when you search for first or last characters). pattern is an expression of the character string data type category. pattern is limited to 8000 characters.
Is an expression, typically a column that is searched for the specified pattern. expression is of the character string data type category.
member.returns: bigint if expression is of the varchar(max) or nvarchar(max) data types; otherwise int.

member.param: Is a character expression that contains the sequence to be found. Wildcard characters can be used; however, the % character must come before and follow pattern (except when you search for first or last characters). pattern is an expression of the character string data type category. pattern is limited to 8000 characters.
Is an expression, typically a column that is searched for the specified pattern. expression is of the character string data type category.
member.returns: bigint if expression is of the varchar(max) or nvarchar(max) data types; otherwise int.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.QuoteName(System.String)

summary.para: Returns a Unicode string with the delimiters added to make the input string a valid SQL Server delimited identifier.

member.param: Is a string of Unicode character data. character_string is sysname and is limited to 128 characters. Inputs greater than 128 characters return NULL.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.QuoteName(System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Returns a Unicode string with the delimiters added to make the input string a valid SQL Server delimited identifier.

member.param: Is a string of Unicode character data. character_string is sysname and is limited to 128 characters. Inputs greater than 128 characters return NULL.

Is a one-character string to use as the delimiter. Can be a single quotation mark ( ' ), a left or right bracket ( [] ), a double quotation mark ( " ), a left or right parenthesis ( () ), a greater than or less than sign ( >< ), a left or right brace ( {} ) or a backtick ( ` ). NULL returns if an unacceptable character is supplied. If quote_character is not specified, brackets are used.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.Replace(System.String,System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Replaces all occurrences of a specified string value with another string value.

member.param: Is the string expression to be searched. string_expression can be of a character or binary data type.

Is the substring to be found. string_pattern can be of a character or binary data type. string_pattern must not exceed the maximum number of bytes that fits on a page. If string_pattern is an empty string (''), string_expression is returned unchanged.
Is the replacement string. string_replacement can be of a character or binary data type.
member.returns: Returns nvarchar if one of the input arguments is of the nvarchar data type; otherwise, REPLACE returns varchar. Returns NULL if any one of the arguments is NULL.

member.returns: Returns the same type as string_expression.

Is an expression of any integer type, including bigint. If integer_expression is negative, NULL is returned.
member.returns: Returns the same type as string_expression.

member.param: Is an expression of character or binary data. character_expression can be a constant, variable, or column. character_expression can be of any data type, except text or ntext, that can be implicitly converted to varchar or nvarchar. Otherwise, use the CAST function to explicitly convert character_expression.

Is a positive integer that specifies how many characters of the character_expression will be returned. If integer_expression is negative, an error is returned. If integer_expression is type bigint and contains a large value, character_expression must be of a large data type such as varchar(max). The integer_expression parameter counts a UTF-16 surrogate character as one character.
member.returns: Returns varchar when character_expression is a non-Unicode character data type. Returns nvarchar when character_expression is a Unicode character data type.

Is the total length. This includes decimal point, sign, digits, and spaces. The default is 10.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.Str``1(``0,System.Int32,System.Int32)

summary.para: Returns character data converted from numeric data. The character data is right-justified, with a specified length and decimal precision.

member.param: Is an expression of approximate numeric (float) data type with a decimal point.
Is the total length. This includes decimal point, sign, digits, and spaces. The default is 10.

Is the number of places to the right of the decimal point. decimal must be less than or equal to 16. If decimal is more than 16 then the result is truncated to sixteen places to the right of the decimal point.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.StringEscape(System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Returns character data converted from numeric data. The character data is right-justified, with a specified length and decimal precision.

member.param: Is a nvarchar expression expression representing the object that should be escaped.
Escaping rules that will be applied. Currently the value supported is 'json'.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.Stuff(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)

summary.para: The STUFF function inserts a string into another string. It deletes a specified length of characters in the first string at the start position and then inserts the second string into the first string at the start position.

member.param: Is an expression of character data. character_expression can be a constant, variable, or column of either character or binary data.

Is an integer value that specifies the location to start deletion and insertion. If start is negative or zero, a null string is returned. If start is longer than the first character_expression, a null string is returned. start can be of type bigint.

Is an integer that specifies the number of characters to delete. If length is negative, a null string is returned. If length is longer than the first character_expression, deletion occurs up to the last character in the last character_expression. If length is zero, insertion occurs at start location and no characters are deleted. length can be of type bigint.

Is an expression of character data. character_expression can be a constant, variable, or column of either character or binary data. This expression replaces length characters of character_expression beginning at start. Providing NULL as the replaceWith_expression, removes characters without inserting anything.
member.returns: Returns character data if character_expression is one of the supported character data types. Returns binary data if character_expression is one of the supported binary data types.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.Substring(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32})

summary.para: Returns part of a character, binary, text, or image expression in SQL Server.

member.param: Is a character, binary, text, ntext, or image expression.

Is an integer or bigint expression that specifies where the returned characters start. (The numbering is 1 based, meaning that the first character in the expression is 1). If start is less than 1, the returned expression will begin at the first character that is specified in expression. In this case, the number of characters that are returned is the largest value of either the sum of start + length - 1 or 0. If start is greater than the number of characters in the value expression, a zero-length expression is returned.

Is a positive integer or bigint expression that specifies how many characters of the expression will be returned. If length is negative, an error is generated and the statement is terminated. If the sum of start and length is greater than the number of characters in expression, the whole value expression beginning at start is returned.
member.returns: Returns character data if expression is one of the supported character data types. Returns binary data if expression is one of the supported binary data types.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.Translate(System.String,System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Returns part of a character, binary, text, or image expression in SQL Server.

member.param: inputString Is the string expression to be searched. inputString can be any character data type (nvarchar, varchar, nchar, char).
Is a string expression containing characters that should be replaced. characters can be any character data type.
Is a string expression containing the replacement characters. translations must be the same data type and length as characters.
member.returns: Returns a character expression of the same data type as inputString where characters from the second argument are replaced with the matching characters from third argument.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.Trim(System.String)

member.param: Is an expression of any character type (nvarchar, varchar, nchar, or char) where characters should be removed.
member.returns: Returns a character expression with a type of string argument where the space character char(32) or other specified characters are removed from both sides. Returns NULL if input string is NULL.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.Trim(System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Removes the space character char(32) or other specified characters from the start and end of a string.

member.param: Is a literal, variable, or function call of any non-LOB character type (nvarchar, varchar, nchar, or char) containing characters that should be removed. nvarchar(max) and varchar(max) types aren't allowed.
Is an expression of any character type (nvarchar, varchar, nchar, or char) where characters should be removed.
member.returns: Returns a character expression with a type of string argument where the space character char(32) or other specified characters are removed from both sides. Returns NULL if input string is NULL.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.Unicode(System.String)

summary.para: Removes the space character char(32) or other specified characters from the start and end of a string.

member.param: Is an nchar or nvarchar expression.

summary.para: Returns a character expression after converting uppercase character data to lowercase.

member.param: Is the string expression of character or binary data. character_expression can be a constant, variable, or column. character_expression must be of a data type that is implicitly convertible to varchar.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.Collate(System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Returns a character expression after converting uppercase character data to lowercase.
Windows_collation_name is the collation name for a Windows Collation Name.

member.param: Is the name of the collation to be applied to the expression, column definition, or database definition. collation_name can be only a specified Windows_collation_name or a SQL_collation_name. collation_name must be a literal value. collation_name cannot be represented by a variable or expression.

summary.para: This function returns the number of attempted connections - both successful and unsuccessful - since SQL Server was last started.
This function returns the amount of time that SQL Server has spent in active operation since its latest start.

Returns the number of output packets written to the network by SQL Server since it was last started.
Returns the number of network packet errors that have occurred on SQL Server connections since SQL Server was last started.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.BinaryCheckSum

summary.para: Returns the binary checksum value computed over a row of a table or over a list of expressions.

member.para:
Specifies that the computation covers all the table columns. BINARY_CHECKSUM ignores columns of noncomparable data types in its computation. Noncomparable data types include
cursor
image
ntext
text
xml
and noncomparable common language runtime (CLR) user-defined types.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.BinaryCheckSum(System.Object[])

summary.para: Returns the binary checksum value computed over a row of a table or over a list of expressions.

member.param: An expression of any type. BINARY_CHECKSUM ignores expressions of noncomparable data types in its computation.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.CheckSum

summary.para: The CHECKSUM function returns the checksum value computed over a table row, or over an expression list. Use CHECKSUM to build hash indexes.

member.para:
This argument specifies that the checksum computation covers all table columns. CHECKSUM returns an error if any column has a noncomparable data type. Noncomparable data types include:
cursor
image
ntext
text
XML
Another noncomparable data type is sql_variant with any one of the preceding data types as its base type.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.CheckSum(System.Object[])

summary.para: The CHECKSUM function returns the checksum value computed over a table row, or over an expression list. Use CHECKSUM to build hash indexes.

member.param: An expression of any type, except a noncomparable data type.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.FormatMessage(System.Int32,System.Object[])

summary.para: Constructs a message from an existing message in sys.messages or from a provided string. The functionality of FORMATMESSAGE resembles that of the RAISERROR statement. However, RAISERROR prints the message immediately, while FORMATMESSAGE returns the formatted message for further processing.

member.param: Is the ID of the message stored in sys.messages. If msg_number is <= 13000, or if the message does not exist in sys.messages, NULL is returned.

Is a parameter value for use in the message. Can be more than one parameter value. The values must be specified in the order in which the placeholder variables appear in the message. The maximum number of values is 20.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlFn.FormatMessage(System.String,System.Object[])

summary.para: Constructs a message from an existing message in sys.messages or from a provided string. The functionality of FORMATMESSAGE resembles that of the RAISERROR statement. However, RAISERROR prints the message immediately, while FORMATMESSAGE returns the formatted message for further processing.

member.param: Is a string enclosed in single quotes and containing parameter value placeholders. The error message can have a maximum of 2,047 characters. If the message contains 2,048 or more characters, only the first 2,044 are displayed and an ellipsis is added to indicate that the message has been truncated. Note that substitution parameters consume more characters than the output shows because of internal storage behavior.

Is a parameter value for use in the message. Can be more than one parameter value. The values must be specified in the order in which the placeholder variables appear in the message. The maximum number of values is 20.

Is the expression to be returned if check_expression is NULL. replacement_value must be of a type that is implicitly convertible to the type of check_expression.
member.returns: Returns the same type as check_expression. If a literal NULL is provided as check_expression, returns the datatype of the replacement_value. If a literal NULL is provided as check_expression and no replacement_value is provided, returns an int.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlServerBulkCopy.MaxParameters
member.remarks: Settings based on https://www.jooq.org/doc/3.12/manual/sql-building/dsl-context/custom-settings/settings-inline-threshold/ We subtract 1 since SQL Server ADO Provider uses one parameter for command.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlServerBulkCopy.MaxSqlLength
member.remarks: Based on https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/sql-server/maximum-capacity-specifications-for-sql-server?redirectedfrom=MSDN&view=sql-server-ver15 Default Max is actually (4096*65536) = 256MIB, but we keep a lower number here to avoid the cost of huge statements.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Undefined
member.summary: Undefined data type.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Char
member.summary: A fixed-length stream of non-Unicode characters ranging between 1 and 8,000 characters.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.VarChar
member.summary: A variable-length stream of non-Unicode characters ranging between 1 and 8,000 characters. Use VarChar when the database column is varchar(max).

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Text
member.summary: A variable-length stream of non-Unicode data with a maximum length of 2 31 -1 (or 2,147,483,647) characters.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.NChar
member.summary: A fixed-length stream of Unicode characters ranging between 1 and 4,000 characters.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.NVarChar
member.summary:
A variable-length stream of Unicode characters ranging between 1 and 4,000 characters. Implicit conversion fails if the string is greater than 4,000 characters. Oracle: We need NVarChar2 in order to insert UTF8 string values. The default Odp VarChar2 dbtype doesnt work with UTF8 values. Note : Microsoft oracle client uses NVarChar value by default.
Same as VARCHAR2 except that the column stores values in the National CS , ie you can store values in Bangla if your National CS is BN8BSCII .If the National CS is of fixed width CS (all characters are represented by a fixed byte ,say 2 bytes for JA16EUCFIXED) , then NVARCHAR2(30) stores 30 Characters. Varchar2 works with 8 bit characters where as Nvarchar2 works ith 16 bit characters. If you have to store data other than english prefer Nvarchar2 or viceversa.
NCHAR and NVARCHAR2 are Unicode datatypes that store Unicode character data. The character set of NCHAR and NVARCHAR2 datatypes can only be either AL16UTF16 or UTF8 and is specified at database creation time as the national character set. AL16UTF16 and UTF8 are both Unicode encoding. The NCHAR datatype stores fixed-length character strings that correspond to the national character set.The NVARCHAR2 datatype stores variable length character strings. When you create a table with an NCHAR or NVARCHAR2 column, the maximum size specified is always in character length semantics. Character length semantics is the default and only length semantics for NCHAR or NVARCHAR2. For example, if national character set is UTF8, then the following statement defines the maximum byte length of 90 bytes: CREATE TABLE tab1 (col1 NCHAR(30)); This statement creates a column with maximum character length of 30. The maximum byte length is the multiple of the maximum character length and the maximum number of bytes in each character. The maximum length of an NVARCHAR2 column is 4000 bytes. It can hold up to 4000 characters. The actual data is subject to the maximum byte limit of 4000. The two size constraints must be satisfied simultaneously at run time.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.NText
member.summary: A variable-length stream of Unicode data with a maximum length of 2 30 - 1 (or 1,073,741,823) characters.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Binary

member.summary: A variable-length stream of binary data ranging between 1 and 8,000 bytes. Implicit conversion fails if the byte array is greater than 8,000 bytes.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions
member.summary: Defines behavior of method.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.MaxBatchSize
member.summary: Number of rows in each batch. At the end of each batch, the rows in the batch are sent to the server.
member.returns: The integer value of the property, or zero if no value has been set.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.KeepIdentity
member.summary: If this option set to true, bulk copy will use values of columns, marked with IsIdentity flag. SkipOnInsert flag in this case will be ignored. Otherwise those columns will be skipped and values will be generated by server. Not compatible with mode.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.ServerName
member.summary: Gets or sets explicit name of target server instead of one, configured for copied entity in mapping schema. See method for support information per provider. Also note that it is not supported by provider-specific insert method.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.DatabaseName
member.summary: Gets or sets explicit name of target database instead of one, configured for copied entity in mapping schema. See method for support information per provider.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.SchemaName
member.summary: Gets or sets explicit name of target schema/owner instead of one, configured for copied entity in mapping schema. See method for support information per provider.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.TableName
member.summary: Gets or sets explicit name of target table instead of one, configured for copied entity in mapping schema.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.TableOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets flags overrides instead of configured for copied entity in mapping schema. See method for support information per provider.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.NotifyAfter
member.summary: Gets or sets counter after how many copied records should be called. E.g. if you set it to 10, callback will be called after each 10 copied records. To disable callback, set this option to 0 (default value).

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.RowsCopiedCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets callback method that will be called by BulkCopy operation after each rows copied. This callback will not be used if set to 0.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.UseParameters
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to Always use Parameters for MultipleRowsCopy. Default is false. If True, provider's override for will be used to determine the maximum number of rows per insert, Unless overridden by .

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.MaxParametersForBatch
member.summary: If set, will override the Maximum parameters per batch statement from .

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.MaxDegreeOfParallelism
member.summary: Implemented only by ClickHouse.Client provider. Defines number of connections, used for parallel insert in mode.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.WithoutSession
member.summary: Implemented only by ClickHouse.Client provider. When set, provider-specific bulk copy will use session-less connection even if called over connection with session. Note that session-less connections cannot be used with session-bound functionality like temporary tables.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyRowsCopied.Abort
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the bulk copy operation should be aborted.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyRowsCopied.RowsCopied
member.summary: Gets a value that returns the number of rows copied during the current bulk copy operation.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyRowsCopied.StartTime
member.summary: Gets operation execution start time.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyType
member.summary: Bulk copy implementation type. For more details on support level by provider see this article.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyType.Default
member.summary: LINQ To DB will select copy method based on current provider. Default method usually set at [PROVIDER_NAME_HERE]Tools.DefaultBulkCopyType.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyType.RowByRow
member.summary: Data will be inserted into table as a sequence of selects, row by row.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyType.MultipleRows
member.summary: Data will be inserted into table as a batch insert using INSERT FROM SELECT or similar code. If method not supported, it will be downgraded to method.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyType.ProviderSpecific
member.summary: Data will be inserted using native bulk copy functionality if supported. If method not supported, it will be downgraded to method.

member.summary: Rollbacks started (if any) transaction, associated with connection. If underlying provider doesn't support asynchonous commit, it will be performed synchonously.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.Expressions.MemberHelper.GetMemberInfoWithType(System.Linq.Expressions.LambdaExpression)
member.summary: Gets the member information with type from given lambda expression.
